text: Charles Sumner "Chuck" Stone, Jr. (July 21, 1924 - April 6, 2014) was an American newspaper editor, columnist, journalist, and writer. He was a Tuskegee Airman during World War II. In the 1940s, he was the first African- American undergraduate in several decades at Wesleyan University. He graduated in the class of 1948 and serving as the commencement speaker. He later received a master's degree in sociology from the University of Chicago. He was the first president of the National Association of Black Journalists (NABJ, 1975-77). He was born in Hartford, Connecticut. Stone died from congestive heart failure on April 6, 2014 in Chapel Hill, North Carolina.
